Directory.name: Directory

instanceMethods.name: constructor
instanceMethods.summary: Configures a new Directory instance, no files are accessed.
instanceMethods.description: Configures a new Directory instance, no files are accessed.

arguments.name: directoryPath
arguments.description: A {String} containing the absolute path to the directory

arguments.name: symlink
arguments.description: A {Boolean} indicating if the path is a symlink. (default: false)

instanceMethods.name: onDidChange
instanceMethods.summary: Invoke the given callback when the directory's contents change.
instanceMethods.description: Invoke the given callback when the directory's contents change.

arguments.name: callback
arguments.description: {Function} to be called when the directory's contents change.

returnValues.description: Returns a {Disposable} on which `.dispose()` can be called to unsubscribe.
Returns a {Boolean}, always false.
Returns a {Boolean}, always true.

instanceMethods.name: isRoot
instanceMethods.summary:
Return a {Boolean}, true if this {Directory} is the root directory
of the filesystem, or false if it isn't.
instanceMethods.description:
Return a {Boolean}, true if this {Directory} is the root directory
of the filesystem, or false if it isn't.

instanceMethods.name: getPath
instanceMethods.description:
This may include unfollowed symlinks or relative directory entries. Or it
may be fully resolved, it depends on what you give it.

returnValues.description: Returns the directory's {String} path.

instanceMethods.name: getRealPathSync
instanceMethods.description:
All relative directory entries are removed and symlinks are resolved to
their final destination.

returnValues.description: Returns this directory's completely resolved {String} path.
Returns the {String} basename of the directory.

Returns the relative {String} path to the given path from this
directory.

instanceMethods.name: getParent
instanceMethods.description: Traverse to the parent directory.

returnValues.description: Returns a {Directory}.

instanceMethods.name: getFile
instanceMethods.summary:
Traverse within this Directory to a child File. This method doesn't
actually check to see if the File exists, it just creates the File object.
instanceMethods.description:
Traverse within this Directory to a child File. This method doesn't
actually check to see if the File exists, it just creates the File object.

arguments.name: filename
arguments.description: The {String} name of a File within this Directory.

returnValues.description: Returns a {File}.

instanceMethods.name: getSubdirectory
instanceMethods.summary:
Traverse within this a Directory to a child Directory. This method
doesn't actually check to see if the Directory exists, it just creates the
Directory object.
instanceMethods.description:
Traverse within this a Directory to a child Directory. This method
doesn't actually check to see if the Directory exists, it just creates the
Directory object.

arguments.name: dirname
arguments.description: The {String} name of the child Directory.

returnValues.description: Returns a {Directory}.

instanceMethods.name: getEntriesSync
instanceMethods.summary: Reads file entries in this directory from disk synchronously.
instanceMethods.description: Reads file entries in this directory from disk synchronously.

returnValues.description: Returns an {Array} of {File} and {Directory} objects.

instanceMethods.name: getEntries
instanceMethods.summary: Reads file entries in this directory from disk asynchronously.
instanceMethods.description: Reads file entries in this directory from disk asynchronously.

arguments.name: callback
arguments.description: A {Function} to call with the following arguments:

returnValues.description:
Returns whether the given path (real or symbolic) is inside this
directory. This method does not actually check if the path exists, it just
checks if the path is under this directory.

Directory.summary: Represents a directory on disk that can be watched for changes.
Directory.description: Represents a directory on disk that can be watched for changes.

File.name: File

instanceMethods.name: constructor
instanceMethods.description: Creates a new file.

arguments.name: filePath
arguments.description: A {String} containing the absolute path to the file

arguments.name: symlink
arguments.description: A {Boolean} indicating if the path is a symlink (default: false).

instanceMethods.name: onDidChange
instanceMethods.summary: Invoke the given callback when the file's contents change.
instanceMethods.description: Invoke the given callback when the file's contents change.

arguments.name: callback
arguments.description: {Function} to be called when the file's contents change.

returnValues.description: Returns a {Disposable} on which `.dispose()` can be called to unsubscribe.

instanceMethods.name: onDidRename
instanceMethods.summary: Invoke the given callback when the file's path changes.
instanceMethods.description: Invoke the given callback when the file's path changes.

arguments.name: callback
arguments.description: {Function} to be called when the file's path changes.

returnValues.description: Returns a {Disposable} on which `.dispose()` can be called to unsubscribe.

instanceMethods.name: onDidDelete
instanceMethods.summary: Invoke the given callback when the file is deleted.
instanceMethods.description: Invoke the given callback when the file is deleted.

arguments.name: callback
arguments.description: {Function} to be called when the file is deleted.

returnValues.description: Returns a {Disposable} on which `.dispose()` can be called to unsubscribe.

instanceMethods.name: onWillThrowWatchError
instanceMethods.summary:
Invoke the given callback when there is an error with the watch.
When your callback has been invoked, the file will have unsubscribed from
the file watches.
instanceMethods.description:
Invoke the given callback when there is an error with the watch.
When your callback has been invoked, the file will have unsubscribed from
the file watches.

children.name: handle
children.description: {Function} call this to indicate you have handled the error. The error will not be thrown if this function is called.

returnValues.description: Returns a {Boolean}, always true.
Returns a {Boolean}, always false.
Returns a {Boolean}, true if the file exists, false otherwise.

instanceMethods.name: getDigest
instanceMethods.summary: Get the SHA-1 digest of this file
instanceMethods.description: Get the SHA-1 digest of this file

returnValues.description: Returns a {String}.

instanceMethods.name: setEncoding
instanceMethods.summary: Sets the file's character set encoding name.
instanceMethods.description: Sets the file's character set encoding name.

returnValues.description: Returns the {String} encoding name for this file (default: 'utf8').
Returns the {String} path for the file.
Returns this file's completely resolved {String} path.

instanceMethods.name: getBaseName
instanceMethods.summary: Return the {String} filename without any directory information.
instanceMethods.description: Return the {String} filename without any directory information.

instanceMethods.name: getParent
instanceMethods.summary: Return the {Directory} that contains this file.
instanceMethods.description: Return the {Directory} that contains this file.

instanceMethods.name: read
instanceMethods.summary: Reads the contents of the file.
instanceMethods.description: Reads the contents of the file.

arguments.name: flushCache
arguments.description: A {Boolean} indicating whether to require a direct read or if a cached copy is acceptable.

returnValues.description: Returns a promise that resovles to a String.

instanceMethods.name: write
instanceMethods.summary: Overwrites the file with the given text.
instanceMethods.description:
Overwrites the file with the given text.

Return undefined.

arguments.name: text
arguments.description: The {String} text to write to the underlying file.

File.summary:
Represents an individual file that can be watched, read from, and
written to.
File.description:
Represents an individual file that can be watched, read from, and
written to.
